extendedIngredients.name: fish
extendedIngredients.original: Even people who aren't crazy about fish will like this recipe. It calls for cheese, mayonaise and lemon juice---a trifecta that can't be beat.

title: Foil Packet Tilapia Crockpot Recipe
summary: Foil Packet Tilapia Crockpot Recipe is a gluten free and pescatarian main course. One portion of this dish contains about 64g of protein, 19g of fat, and a total of 439 calories. This recipe serves 4 and costs $5.86 per serving. Head to the store and pick up mayonnaise, salt and pepper, cheese, and a few other things to make it today. 315 people have tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 93%, this dish is great. Try Grilled Lemon Tilapian and Summer Vegetables in a Foil Packet, Chicken Milano Foil Packet, and Foil-Packet Chicken Puttanesca for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.
